title: Australia's universal healthcare is crumbling. Can it be saved?
snippets: More and more Australians, regardless of where they live, are delaying or going without the care they need.
titles: Australia's universal healthcare is crumbling. Can it be saved?
summary: A growing number of Australians across all regions are postponing or forgoing necessary healthcare. This trend highlights concerns about accessibility and affordability of medical services in the country.

title: Jimmy Butler sitting out for Warriors in Game 3 of first-round series against Rockets
snippets: Warriors star Jimmy Butler is out for Game 3 of Golden Stateâ€™s first-round playoff series against the Houston Rockets on Saturday night after injuring his pelvis and suffering a deep gluteal muscle contusion in a hard fall during Game 2.  The best-of-seven series is tied at one game apiece with the next two games on the Warriors' home floor.
titles: Jimmy Butler sitting out for Warriors in Game 3 of first-round series against Rockets
summary: Warriors player Jimmy Butler will miss Game 3 of the first-round playoff series against the Houston Rockets due to a pelvis injury and a deep gluteal muscle contusion sustained in Game 2. The series is currently tied 1-1, with the next two games scheduled to be played on the Warriors' home court.

title: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator

titles: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
summary: A proposal has been made to integrate the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) into the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This move is seen as a part of Donald Trump's broader deregulatory agenda, aiming to streamline regulatory processes and reduce oversight complexities for public companies.

title: Less intensive farming works best for agricultural soil
snippets: The less intensively you manage the soil, the better the soil can function. Such as not plowing as often or using more grass-clover mixtures as cover crops. Surprisingly, it applies to both conventional and organic farming.
titles: Less intensive farming works best for agricultural soil
summary: Research indicates that less intensive soil management, including reduced plowing and the use of grass-clover mixtures as cover crops, enhances soil functionality. This finding is applicable across both conventional and organic farming practices, suggesting a universal benefit to adopting less disruptive agricultural techniques.
